Where To Get Food (Esp. For Late At Night)

Has it ever so happened that you're camped out in the (NT Lab/HP Lab/Hollister Lab/Etc) late at night, you're hungry, you'd like to get something to eat, but at the same time, you really don't feel like a multihour excursion to find food? Below is a list that should help: easy to get food that is either in (reasonably) easy walking distance, or that it can be delivered to Upson hall.

Note that nothing on this page should be taken as an endorsement of any of these options. I haven't been to most of these places and don't know what they're like. Feel free to send me email with comments, suggestions, and especially with ideas for more places to get food late at night
The vending machines
in the basement of Upson are a perenial favorite: have drinks, food (snacks, some sandwiches,etc), and is quick and easy to get to. And the really nice thing about them is that they're open 24-7 (since Upson isn't locked). There's also a couple of vending machines in Hollister (in the basement, south of the auditorium)

Meal Plan:

If you're signed up for meal plan, you might want to know the schedule. While it isn't open too late, Late Night is a good place to get food for all-night programming binges. But remember that there's no late night on Saturdays! There's also a rumor that one of the cash-only dining areas in the Statler will be made co-op in order to compensate for the loss of Sage Dining.

ACSU Events
The ACSU has a time-honored tradition of serving Free Pizza at it's events, especially at the Company InfoSessions, in which companies that are looking to recruit technically-minded people (read: computer junkies) for excellent jobs. These Infosessions are free and open to anyone and everyone who wants to attend, making them an excellent source of sustenence, both in the short term ("What do I eat tonight?"), and in the long term ("What will get me food when I graduate?")

Louie's Lunch
on north campus is a hike from the Engineering Quad, but open late. Since it parks across from Risley, it's probably easier to get something on your way back to your North campus residence than to walk there and then back to the Eng. Quad

Hot Truck
on West Campus. It appears late at night on road just west (ie, downhill) of Noyes. Hot truck tends to be open late, and isn't unreasonably far from the Engineering Quad

CollegeTown
Since these shops tend to cater to students, and there are at least a couple shops that are open until the wee hours of the night.. I don't have a complete list of what's there, and since it's just over the footbridge (i.e., less than 2 minutes slow walk from Upson), the best thing to do is simply wander over and look for something you like. There's more stuff than what's below, but you get the idea -- wander around and find something you like!

CollegeTown Bagels (open till 2:00am daily)

The Charriot (open till 11:30pm Tues-Sat, 11:00pm on Sun,Mon, serving pizza, subs, burgers,etc)

The Nines (open till 1:00am, and it will deliver if you're farther away)(pizza,etc)

Ruloff's

Wendy's

Taco Bell

Subway

Kayuga (sushi, etc)

Little Joe's Restaurant (open 5-10pm, though I think this is more for dine-in Italian food)

Cafes:

Stella's (on College Ave)

Jasmin's

Food You Can Get Delivered
I've heard that there used to be a page for "Food By Phone" web page somewhere in the Cornell Web, but I haven't been able to find it. When I checked out the yellow pages and called around, here's what I found: (Note that anything open past midnight is highlit).

Note that there are payphones on the first floor of Upson, and there used to be a phone in the M.Eng on Upson's third floor (Assuming that the lounge is even there now). The Statler would probably be another good place to try and order food from.
